Title: Aliko Dangote: The face of Nigeria’s  energy security, industrialisation
Summary: This year is arguably the year of trade wars . Tariff turmoil and attendant threats formed a familiar pattern . The bully in President Donald Trump led the execution of widespread tariffs .

Title: NLC vows to reject unjust tax system
Summary: Nigeria Labour Congress (NLC) vows to reject any tax system it described as distorted, falsified, and unjust . Ahead of January 1, 2026, implementation of the Federal Government's new tax reforms .

Title: Nigeria’s current account surplus sheds 41% in Q3, says CBN
Summary: Nigeria recorded a current account surplus of $3.42 billion in the third quarter (Q3) of 2025 . This represents a 41.14 per cent decline from the $5.81 billion surplus recorded in the previous quarter .

Title: State police and south-east: Constitutional imperative not political luxury
Summary: Debate on state police in Nigeria has long been framed as a political gamble . Reform fraught with risks of abuse and fragmentation . Nowhere is the inadequacy of this framing more evident than in the South-East .

Title: Adeleke, Aiyedatiwa sign 2026 budgets as Ogun Assembly passes N1.668tr proposal
Summary: Governor Ademola Adeleke, yesterday, signed Osun State’s 2026 appropriation bill of N705 billion into law with a vow to ensure full implementation . Surrounded by his deputy, Kola Adewusi, Speaker, Adewale Egbedun..

Title: Dollar to Naira exchange rate today, December 30, 2025
Summary: The Nigerian Naira maintained a steady yet cautious position against the United States Dollar during early trading sessions today, Tuesday, December 30, 2025 .

Title: Horror crash: AJ rushed to Duchess Hospital, 2 aides dead
Summary: Anthony Joshua narrowly escaped death in a ghastly road accident in Ogun State . The former world heavyweight boxing champion was rushed to Duchess Hospital, 2 aides dead .

Title: Assault: Ex-AIT boss, Obaseki, narrates ordeal as Amnesty, PDP, others demand justice
Summary: Former Managing Director of African Independent Television, AIT, Dr. Pedro Obaseki, has narrated how he was allegedly assaulted, abducted and detained on Sunday, December 28, 2025, while playing football in Benin City, Edo State . He has vowed to pursue the matter through civil and criminal processes .

Title: 2027: I’m better prepared to lead Nigeria — Peter Obi
Summary: Peter Obi has described himself as better prepared to tackle Nigeria’s economic and security challenges if given the chance . The 2023 Presidential candidate of the Labour Party, LP, said he is better prepared than ever .

Title: Don’t abandon your Christian faith, Mrs Akume begs husband
Summary: Regina Akume has urged her husband, the Secretary to the Government of the Federation, Senator George Akume, to fully return to Christianity . She said his achievements in life were rooted in his Christian faith . Mrs. Regina made the appeal .

Title: Explosion rocks Kebbi hospital, police begin probe
Summary: An explosion, on Tuesday, rocked the General Hospital, Bagudo, Kebbi State . The explosion was said to have hit the hospital in the early hours of Tuesday . The state police command, in confirming the incident, however, said no casualty was recorded . Security agencies swiftly secured the area to prevent further threats .

Title: Atletico Madrid legend, Enrique Collar, dies at 91
Summary: Enrique Collar captained Atletico Madrid to a league title and three cup successes in the 1960s . The left winger scored 105 goals in 470 appearances for Atletico between 1953 and 1969 . Collar also won the 1962 European Cup Winners' Cup and earned 16 caps for Spain, playing at the 1962 World Cup in Chile .

Title: British envoy, govs visit Anthony Joshua in Lagos hospital
Summary: Deputy Head of Mission of the British High Commission, Simon Field, has visited Anthony Joshua in hospital following a fatal road accident along the Lagos–Ibadan Expressway . Field met with Joshua during the visit and also held discussions with Ogun State Governor, Dapo Abiodun, and his Lagos State counterpart, Babaj

Title: NNPC opens talks to sell stakes in assets –Report
Summary: The Nigerian National Petroleum Company Limited has begun moves to sell stakes in some of its oil and gas assets, a new report by Reuters has revealed . This is as the state-owned energy firm seeks to optimise its portfolio and attract fresh investment into the sector .

Title: Banditry: PDP, AbdulRazaq trade blame as hoodlums flog female protesters
Summary: The Kwara State chapter of the Peoples Democratic Party has accused the AbdulRahman AbdulRazaq-led government of a “collapse of leadership” following the attack on women protesters at the Government House, Ilorin .
